alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 12 at 10:01PM PDT until September 15 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM PDT WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Strong rip currents and elevated surf expected. Surf will be 4-6 ft, with sets to 7 ft. Highest surf will be in northern Orange County. * WHERE...Orange County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Strong rip and longshore currents will produce dangerous swimming conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A south swell of 2-3 ft from 190-200 degrees at 15-17 seconds will build Wednesday, peak Wednesday night and Thursday, and decrease Friday.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
